title: 'Safety in numbers': calculation and document re-use in knowledge work
abstract:
This paper was originally presented at ACM 2001 International Conference 
on Supporting Group Work, Boulder, Colorado, 1-3 October 2001.
rawRecordXml:
<record><header><identifier>
oai:www.e-space.mmu.ac.uk:2173/8412</identifier><datestamp>2008-08-13T09:46:31Z</datestamp><setSpec>hdl_2173_687</setSpec></header><metadata><oai_dc:dc xmlns:dc="http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/" xmlns:oai_dc="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance" xsi:schemaLocation="http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc/ http://www.openarchives.org/OAI/2.0/oai_dc.xsd" ><dc:title>'Safety in numbers': calculation and document re-use in knowledge work</dc:title><dc:creator>Harper, Richard</dc:creator><dc:creator>Proctor, Robert</dc:creator><dc:creator>Randall, David</dc:creator><dc:creator>Rouncefield, Mark</dc:creator><dc:subject>Ethnography</dc:subject><dc:subject>Knowledge work</dc:subject><dc:subject>Document use</dc:subject><dc:description>This paper presents detailed examples of document use and
re-use, through an ethnographic study of the knowledge
work associated with road safety audit in a civil engineering
consultancy The paper incorporates some detailed
observation of practices, conversations, and other activities
occurring around document re-use in everyday work. It
outlines some aspects of the everyday use and re-use of
engineering documents in the practical accomplishment of everyday knowledge work as the first stage in considering how these activities can be technologically supported.</dc:description><dc:description>This paper was originally presented at ACM 2001 International Conference 
on Supporting Group Work, Boulder, Colorado, 1-3 October 2001.</dc:description><dc:publisher>ACM Press</dc:publisher><dc:date>2007-02-14T16:16:25Z</dc:date><dc:type>Article</dc:type><dc:format>YES</dc:format><dc:identifier>Proceedings of the 2001 International ACM SIGGROUP Conference on Supporting Group Work, pp. 242-251</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>1581132948</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>10.1145/500286.500322</dc:identifier><dc:identifier>http://hdl.handle.net/2173/8412</dc:identifier><dc:language>en</dc:language><dc:relation>http://delivery.acm.org/10.1145/510000/500322/p242-harper.pdf?key1=500322&key2=8529641711&coll=portal&dl=ACM&CFID=15151515&CFTOKEN=6184618</dc:relation><dc:relation>http://www.acm.org/conferences/group/conferences/group01/</dc:relation></oai_dc:dc></metadata></record>
